Changing File Descriptions: stcmd dsc

Use stcmd dsc to change a file description from the command line. This command creates a new file revision with new description as one of its properties.

Syntax

stcmd dsc -p "projectSpecifier" [-pwdfile "filePath"] [-cmp] [-csf] [-encrypt encryptionType] [-is] [-q] [-x] [-stop] [-rp "folderPath" | -fp "folderPath"] [-filter "fileStatus"] -d "description" [files...]

Example

The following example uses stcmd dsc to change the description of stdafx.cpp in User Manual, a child of the root folder StarDraw (in the StarDraw view of the StarDraw project).

stcmd dsc -p "JMarsh:password@Orion:49201/StarDraw/StarDraw/SourceCode" -d "SourceCode for StarTeam" "stdafx.cpp"

 

For more information, see Using Common stcmd Options.
